title: External environment module not found
body:
I am looking into using Spack to manage a small number of packages on a HPC for my research group. The HPC has an existing large variety of environment modules installed by the administrators, which I would like to use from within Spack.

To get a handle on how Spack works I have created an empty repository with a single package that depends on MPI
```python
class Hdf5(AutotoolsPackage):
    homepage = "https://support.hdfgroup.org/HDF5/"
    url      = "https://support.hdfgroup.org/ftp/HDF5/current18/src/hdf5-1.8.18.tar.bz2"    
    version('1.8.18', '29117bf488887f89888f9304c8ebea0b')
    depends_on('mpi')
    def configure_args(self):
        args = ['--enable-mpi']
        return args
```
and I have set up the central MPI module in `packages.yaml` following http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_settings.html#external-packages
```yaml
packages:
    openmpi:
        buildable: False
        modules:
            openmpi@1.10.2%intel@17.0.1.132: openmpi/1.10.2
    all:
        compiler:
            - intel
        providers:
            mpi:
                - openmpi
```
My understanding is that this will run `module load openmpi/1.10.2` when building the package

If I try to install the package I get the following error:
```
$ spack --debug install hdf5
==> Reading config file /short/w35/saw562/scratch/spack/spack/etc/spack/defaults/packages.yaml
==> Reading config file /home/562/saw562/.spack/packages.yaml
==> READ LOCK: /home/562/saw562/.spack/cache/providers/.arccss-index.yaml.lock[0:0] [Acquiring]
==> READ LOCK: /home/562/saw562/.spack/cache/providers/.arccss-index.yaml.lock[0:0] [Released]
==> '/opt/Modules/3.2.6/bin/modulecmd' 'python' 'show' 'openmpi/1.10.2'
==> Error: The spec 'mpi' is configured as not buildable, and no matching external installs were found
```
It appears that the installer is not able to find the openmpi module, although `modulecmd python show openmpi/1.10.2` works fine. Is there something special that it's looking for inside the module?
